editorialNotes.standard: Now hereâs how you build a sequel! With The Room Three, Fireproof Games kept everything we love about this seriesâits chilling atmosphere, mind-bending puzzles and beautiful visualsâwhile making masterful enhancements. The story continues with trials set by a creepy new nemesis, The Craftsman. As you explore huge areas and tiny ones, the challenges feel increasingly epic, and a better-than-ever hint system ensures that finding solutions is super-rewarding.

ios.subtitle: Trickier A Little to the Left

editorialNotes.standard: You might get stuck the first time you play Gorogoa. But once the gears of your brain settle into the right configurations, youâll see how smart this mix of art and perspective really is. Layers pile upon layers, doors transport you between realities, strange creatures and wild environments blend together into a fascinating interactive collage youâll want to peel apart to discover what lies underneath.

editorialNotes.standard: Enigmatic settings and storytelling enrich the mysteries of Leonardo da Vinciâs gadgetry in this escape room puzzle seriesâ fantastic conclusion.

When dinosaurs collide with LEGO bricks, you donât have to be Mr. DNA to know the result is pure fun. Starring characters and creatures from all four Jurassic Park movies, this fantastic adventure lets you relive your favorite moments from the series and even create new ones with your own custom dinos. Full of all the humor, action, and surprises you expect, itâs a wacky team-up of T-Rex proportions.
Search for a missing dog through lavishly illustrated cityscapes in this relaxing adventure game.

editorialNotes.standard: The studio behind Blek has created another amazing puzzle game that evolves into fascinating forms. Thereâs always something new to learn and youâll be challenged to consider all angles of these smartly designed levels. With beautiful minimalist visuals and enchanting sound, Frost artfully engages body and mind.

editorialNotes.standard: The enchantingly eccentric Rusty Lake series heads underground! Solve strange puzzles in train stations representing different eras of a womanâs life.

After a long day at work, itâs bath time! But Swampyâs shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.Â

editorialNotes.standard: When young astronaut Kosmo sees his robot girlfriend, Nova, blown to pieces before his eyes, he gallantly sets off across the galaxy to find his belovedâs parts and put her back together. This beautiful and whimsical point-and-click adventure will steal your heart as you visit dozens of kooky planets and encounter everything from alien arcades to robot discos. Each unique world introduces adorable critters, fantastic sights, clever puzzles to solve and tokens of affection to discover. Star-crossed romance has never felt so rewarding.

ios.subtitle: A story of beauty and illusion

editorialNotes.standard: We couldnât wait to go back to the land of twisty towers and uncanny beautyâand this sequel didnât let us down. With its striking colours and level design, itâs even more stunning than the first game. New elements like light beams and controlling two characters make the puzzles even trickier. The bond between that mother and child is what weâll remember most, thoughâtheir relationship moved us in a way few games do.
editorialNotes.short: An unforgettable adventure full of challenging puzzles and gorgeous visuals.

editorialNotes.standard: Imagine WALLÂ·E directed by Tim Burtonâthatâs the weird, wonderful world of Machinarium. But this cute robotâs quest for love combines tons more influencesâlike point-and-click adventures, hidden-object puzzlers, and comic booksâfor a truly unique experience. Challenging but full of awesome âaha!â moments, itâs an artistic odyssey that looks amazing on iPhone, iPad, or Apple TV.

Mesmerising from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, youâll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. Itâs a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwoâs adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.
editorialNotes.short: Traverse mind-bending levels that are structurally impossible

editorialNotes.standard: If you can doodle, you can play this one-of-a-kind Apple Design Award winner. Just draw a lineâany lineâand watch it spring to life across the screen, following your gestures to collect coloured dots and avoid black holes. But as the holes form increasingly elaborate obstacles, only the most ingenious doodles will do. With endless solutions to every challenge, itâs a stylish, supremely satisfying test of your creativity and puzzle-solving prowess.

editorialNotes.standard: Being able to write computer code is a supremely useful talent, but learning the basics can be a tough, tedious slog. Human Resource Machine wraps computer logic fundamentals inside a wonderful, whimsical puzzle game, full of cartoon conveyer belts and demanding managers. Itâs so much fun you might not realise how much knowledge youâre soaking up.
